column1: #Text=Around 170 workers were trapped in the Chinese Chenjiashan mine, early Sunday morning, November 28th, the BBC reports.
#Text=Chinese state officials said that 123 workers managed to escape the facilities.
#Text=Many of those who escaped the mines are suffering from carbon monoxide poisoning.
#Text=Since the accident, there has been no contact with the 170 workers trapped inside, although the initial number of 183 people still in the complex was revised downwards.
#Text=China has had a long history of mining accidents &mdash;its mines are known as being among the most dangerous in the world.
#Text=Last month, more than 150 people died after a gas explosion in a mine in the Henan province.

#Text=The official tally of 4,153 mine fatalities during the first nine months of this year is actually a 13% improvement over the same period last year, which had a total of 6,246 mine worker deaths &mdash;4,620 of them coal mines. 5,203 deaths occurred among workers in other China industries.
